page.title: 05THROWLEY SCHOOL GARDEN
page.content: Throwley is a school in the country- side. All the children enjoy being involved in gardening. We have a shed for all the gardening tools, and a greenhouse for raising seedlings such as lettuce and tomatoes. We planted wallflowers, onions and broadbeans last Autumn. This Summer we are growing runner beans,marrows, cucumbers, spring onions, peas, potatoes,lettuce, carrots,beetroot, turnip,sweet peas, radishes and tomatoes. When the crops are ready we share them out and take them home. We put wire around the plot to keep rabbits out, and use netting to keep birds, like pigeons, out. The soil is well drained and dries out quickly in Summer, so we use a hosepipe for watering.
